text: Deolus W. Husband (June 19, 1959 – November 13, 1989) was an American composer. ==Biography== Husband was born in Raleigh, Mississippi. He attended the University of Southern Mississippi for Bachelor's degree, graduating in 1981.Deolus W. Decie Husband, A Collection of Original Compositions (B.M. thesis, University of Southern Mississippi, Hattiesburg, MS, 1981. At the Manhattan School of Music he studied composition with John Corigliano and Ludmila Ulehla, receiving his doctorate in 1987. Husband's partner was Edwin Alexander, a bassoonist. ==Legacy== Before he died, Husband became involved with the Estate Project for Artists With AIDS. After his death, Maury Newberger (Husband's representative at the Estate Project) set up The Deolus Husband Scholarship for Composition at the Manhattan School of Music."Named Endowments," Manhattan School of Music (website, accessed, 18 July 2019). Husband's manuscripts were donated by Newberger to the Music Division of the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:1989 deaths Category:People from Raleigh, Mississippi Category:American male composers Category:Manhattan School of Music alumni Category:AIDS-related deaths in Mississippi Category:University of Southern Mississippi alumni Category:LGBT musicians from the United States Category:LGBT people from Mississippi
